availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick A. Jennings, Jr. (Minnesota farmer and officer in United States Colored Troops regiments)

body.p: Minnesota farmer and officer in United States Colored Troops. Pennsylvania native. Son of Frederick A. Jennings and Mary A. Jennings. Married to Elizabeth Ellen Galliher Jennings in Adams County, Illinois, in 1863. Father of Mary Jennings. Student in Centre County, Pennsylvania, in 1850. Served in the 2nd Minnesota Volunteer Infantry Regiment as a private from July 5, 1861, to April 30, 1862. Farmer in Minnetrista County, Minnesota, in 1863. Served in the 121st United States Colored Infantry Regiment as second lieutenant from September 7, 1864 to June 30, 1865. Served in the 13th United States Colored Heavy Artillery Regiment as second lieutenant from July 1, 1865 to November 18, 1865. Served in the 125th United States Colored Infantry Regiment as second lieutenant and first lieutenant from December 23, 1865 to December 20, 1867.

Marriage Records, Illinois Marriages. Adams County Marriages, 1863, Film #001870158.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served the United States Colored Troops: 56th-138th USCT Infantry, 1864-1866, NARA Roll RG94-USCT-121-Bx09.

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served the United States Colored Troops: 56th-138th USCT Infantry, 1864-1866, NARA Roll RG94-USCT-125-Bx28.
